description: From either French assassin or Italian assassino, from Arabic أَسَاسِيِّين‎ (ʔasāsiyyīn, “people who are faithful to the foundation [of the faith]”) and the folkloric etymology Arabic حَشَّاشِين‎ (ḥaššāšīn, “hashish users; low-lives”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A member of the Nizari Ismaili Muslim community of the Alamut Period.
Someone who intentionally kills a person, especially a professional who kills a public or political figure.

verbs.description: assassin (third-person singular simple present assassins, present participle assassining, simple past and past participle assassined)
